meanings.definition: To remove or diminish the features of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to defeature the old painting by painting over the original design.
meanings.sent2: The construction work will defeature the natural beauty of the park.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally defeatured the portrait by spilling paint on it.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to defeature the once vibrant landscape, leaving it barren and desolate.
meanings.sent5: The decision to defeature the historic building sparked controversy among the community.

meanings.definition: The act of making something less attractive or appealing.
meanings.sent1: The defeature of the garden was evident after the harsh winter destroyed the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The defeature of the advertisement led to a decrease in sales for the company.
meanings.sent3: The defeature of the cake was unintentional, but it ended up looking like modern art.
meanings.sent4: The defeature of the once bustling street left it deserted and uninviting.
meanings.sent5: The defeature of the movie set was necessary for the plot twist, but it disappointed the audience.
